Metadata.Title: Sessions Are Destroyed When Users Log Out
Metadata.DirectLink: Sessions Are Destroyed When Users Log Out

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
* Web Applications * Server-side
==What to Check For==
Verify that sessions are destroyed when users log out.
==Why==
Invalidating sessions when users log out makes it harder to hijack them.
==How to Check==
To verify that sessions are destroyed when users log out:
# **Identify logout functionality.** Find code that is responsible for the logout functionality. # **Verify that logout code destroys user sessions.** Examine logout code to make sure that it clears all session data and make sure that it destroys the session cookie.
==How to Fix==
To invalidate sessions when users log out:
# **Identify logout functionality.** Find code that is responsible for the logout functionality. # **Add code to invalidate sessions.** Add code to the logout function to invalidate the session.
